Note:
Critical edition Fox (1981)
XFox, Denton. The Poems of Robert Henryson. Oxford: Clarendon, 1981, 132-53.
Versification: — seven-line, ten-line, two-line — ababbcc, aabaabbcbc, aa
_description: Robert Henryson, Orpheus and Eurydice — 52 rhyme royal stanzas; five 10-line stanzas (aabaabbcbc); 218 lines in couplets

Banna.First Lines:
The nobilnes and grit magnificensOf prince and lord quhai list to
                    magnifie…
Banna.Last Lines:
…In perfyte luve As he is gloriusAnd thus endis þe taill
                    of orpheus
Banna.Note:
Treated as one of Henryson’s Fables, interrupting the segments of
                    Fables in this MS, and having title by a later hand added to left margin,
                    ‘Fable VI. Orpheus & Eurydice’ (f. 317v); 633 lines
                    in rhyme royal.
Banna.Attributed Title: Orpheus & Eurydice (added by later hand, f. 317v)

Asloan.First Lines:
THe nobilnes and gret magnificenceOff Prince or Lord quha list to
                    magnify…
Asloan.Last Lines:
…In parfyte luf as he Is gloriusAnd þus endis þe
                    tale of orpheus
Asloan.Attributed Title:
Heir followis þe buke of orpheus And Erudices his quene (f. 247);
                    Explicit þe buke of orpheus (f. 256v)

ESRORH13.First Lines:
…Wen sche [ ]aid w[ ] allway it [ ]and we sal les see mot I
                    hay[ ]…
ESRORH13.Last Lines:
…and wan þe Ioy of hewin so hiegod grany ws all
                    þairin to be
ESRORH13.Note:
Folios now disbound and mounted as bifolia, with sides of leaves (i.e.
                    original pages) indicated by column letters above.
